meanings.definition: Outdated or outmoded in style or fashion.
meanings.sent1: Her demoded dress looked old-fashioned at the party.
meanings.sent2: The demoded technology was replaced by newer models.
meanings.sent3: The demoded hat made everyone chuckle at its vintage charm.
meanings.sent4: His demoded taste in music was like listening to a time capsule.
meanings.sent5: The demoded furniture in the room transported us back in time.

meanings.definition: No longer in use or fashionable.
meanings.sent1: The demoded phone was kept as a nostalgic relic.
meanings.sent2: Those demoded shoes are not trendy anymore.
meanings.sent3: She found a demoded record player in the attic and laughed.
meanings.sent4: The demoded trends of the past seemed distant and faded.
meanings.sent5: The demoded posters on the wall reminded him of his youth.

meanings.definition: To make something outdated or unfashionable.
meanings.sent1: She demoded her wardrobe by donating old clothes.
meanings.sent2: The company's decision to demode the product surprised many.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly demoded his friend's taste in music by playing a vinyl record.
meanings.sent4: The new fashion trend quickly demoded the previous style.
meanings.sent5: The designer's bold move demoded traditional fashion norms.
